      var cryptoEvents;
      // 1. declare `userAccount` here

      function startApp() {
        var cryptoEventsAddress = "0xeD0eCBeD8269f54DB2882a6Eb00597644C775b44";
        cryptoEvents = new web3js.eth.Contract(cryptoEventsABI, cryptoEventsAddress);

        var accountInterval = setInterval(function() {
          // Check if account has changed
          if (web3.eth.accounts[0] !== userAccount) {
            userAccount = web3.eth.accounts[0];
            // Call some function to update the UI with the new account
            updateInterface();
            }
          }, 100);
      }

      function getEventDetails(id) {
        return cryptoEvent.methods.events(id).call()
      }

      function eventToOwner(id) {
        return cryptoEvents.methods.eventToOwner(id).call()
      }

      function getEventByOwner(owner) {
        return cryptoEvents.methods.getOwnerEvents(owner).call()
      }

      window.addEventListener('load', function() {

        // Checking if Web3 has been injected by the browser (Mist/MetaMask)
        if (typeof web3 !== 'undefined') {
          // Use Mist/MetaMask's provider
          web3js = new Web3(web3.currentProvider);
        } else {
          // Handle the case where the user doesn't have Metamask installed
          // Probably show them a message prompting them to install Metamask
          console.log("Metamask needed")
        }

        // Now you can start your app & access web3 freely:
        startApp()

      })
    </script>

val = {};
val.payload = "" + msg.payload.col1
+ msg.payload.col2 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col3 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col4 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col5 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col6 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col7 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col8 + "; "
+ msg.payload.col9;
